description_txt: stated on January 28, 2016 in the Republican debate in Des Moines, Iowa:
quote_txt: Neighbors of the San Bernardino shooters "knew that they were talking about trying to take our country and attack it."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2016 in comments during the Iowa Republican presidential debate:
quote_txt: "I have not insulted Donald personally."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2016 in a Fox News debate :
quote_txt: "Barack Obama, right now, No. 1, over seven years has dramatically degraded our military."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2016 in a news release:
quote_txt: Donald Trump’s decision to skip the Fox News/Google debate in Des Moines "is near unprecedented."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2016 in a speech in Burlington, Iowa:
quote_txt: "I am the only candidate on either side who has laid out a specific plan about what I would do to defeat ISIS."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2016 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "A lot of student loans are already refinanced by the federal government."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2016 in a town hall in Norwalk, Iowa:
quote_txt: "When they say Mexico can't pay for the wall, I say of course they can. We have a trade deficit with Mexico that's unbelievably big. ... It's billions and billions of dollars -- far more than what we're talking about for the wall."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2016 in Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C.:
quote_txt: Under Ted Cruz’s tax plan, "businesses will now have to pay 16 percent on the money they make. They will also have to pay 16 percent on the money they pay their employees."

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2016 in comments on "Meet the Press.":
quote_txt: Says his views on reparations for slavery are the same as Barack Obama's and Hillary Clinton's.

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2016 in a rally flier:
quote_txt: "Since John F. Kennedy was assassinated in 1963, more Americans have died by gunfire within our own country than American servicemen and women who were killed in all our wars."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2016 in a House Health Innovation Subcommittee meeting:
quote_txt: "Anyone can die of a toothache."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2016 in a town hall meeting in Underwood, Iowa.:
quote_txt: "Almost all of the polls that have come out suggest that I am a much stronger candidate against the Republicans than is Hillary Clinton."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 26, 2016

description_txt: stated on January 23, 2016 in an appearance in Ankeny, Iowa:
quote_txt: "In 40 years of broadcast, I have never endorsed any candidate."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2016 in a column posted on Medium.com:
quote_txt: "Fifty years ago, the average GM employee could pay for a year of a son or daughter’s college tuition on just two weeks wages."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2016 in comments during the Nevada Battleborn Battleground Dinner at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas:
quote_txt: Says Cresent Hardy agreed with Mitt Romney "about the 47 percent" and said that "people with disabilities are, and I quote him, ‘a drain on society.’ "

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2016 in a speech:
quote_txt: Martin Luther King Jr. "was a Republican."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2016 in a State of the State address:
quote_txt: "Two million new jobs have been created," in California since 2011.

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Says a Ted Cruz ad has "got me bull-dozing down a house. I never bulldozed it down. It's false advertising."

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Says Donald Trump "thinks that climate change is a hoax, invented by the Chinese."

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2016 in a report:
quote_txt: "In reality, gas produced by fracking is worse for the climate than coal."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2015 in Conservatives in Action blog post:
quote_txt: Texas has the sixth-highest property taxes in the nation.

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2016 in a New Hampshire appearance:
quote_txt: "Blue Cross Blue Shield cancelled all their individual (health care) policies in the state of Texas, effective Dec. 31."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2016 in a speech:
quote_txt: "According to the most recent report, Wisconsin’s high school graduation rates are also up again -- to third best in the country."

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2016 in response to President Barack Obama's State of the Union address:
quote_txt: Under Barack Obama, "the fewest number of adults are working since Jimmy Carter’s presidency."

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2016 in a roundtable discussion on CNN:
quote_txt: "Donald Trump is appealing as much to Democrats as he is to Republicans."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 21, 2016

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2016 in a Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C.:
quote_txt: China has "total control, just about, of North Korea."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2016 in a town hall in Underwood, Iowa:
quote_txt: "I have a D-minus voting record from the NRA."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2016 in an Iowa Right to Life event in Des Moines:
quote_txt: The United States has a "record number of abortions year after year after year."

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2016 in an interview on CNN Reliable Sources:
quote_txt: Says the Democratic Party created a debate schedule "to maximize the opportunity for voters to see our candidates."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2016 in comments at a campaign organizing event:
quote_txt: "Every piece of legislation, just about, that I ever introduced (in the U.S. Senate) had a Republican co-sponsor."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 20, 2016
